segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the type and function of the message and to transmit its identifying number.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify the date and, when required, the time of the creation of the message and optionally to specify other process dates which apply to the whole message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify references which apply to the whole message and optionally to specify related dates.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify a reference for the message.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify dates related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify the parties associated with the message.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the resident bank.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or a department for the party to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to specify a communication number for the party, such as phone or fax number.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to specify additional free text information related to the party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to specify the details of the reported account and the details of the reported individual transactions.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify the reference of the reported account.

segment.name: Currencies
segment.documentation: CUX, A segment to specify the currency of the reported account.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to specify the opening balance and the closing balance of the reported account.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to specify the relevant country related to the reported account.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to specify information relating to a transaction or position.

segment.name: Requirements and conditions
segment.documentation: RCS, A segment to specify the reason for the transaction or the type of position.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to specify information in clear and free form to provide explanations about the reason for the transaction or the position.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to specify the amount and details associated with each different reason of transaction or position.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to specify the amount, and if necessary the currency, of the transaction or of the position.

segment.name: Attribute
segment.documentation: ATT, A segment to specify the type of the reported amount.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify the identification of additional related parties such as the Payor, the Payee or a third party).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to specify the details related to transactions on financial securities.

segment.name: Related identification numbers
segment.documentation: GIR, A segment to identify the type of securities (shares, bonds, etc).

segment.name: Quantity
segment.documentation: QTY, A segment to specify the quantity of the security.

segment.name: Price details
segment.documentation: PRI, A segment to specify the face value of the security.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to specify the references and dates of the transaction.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to specify the serial number of the transaction.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify the date of the transaction.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify countries involved in the transaction, such country of origin or destination of the goods, direct investment country, donation acting country, payment transaction country (creditor or debtor) or the country in which the construction work is done.

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, A segment to specify total values for control purposes.
